poem:
Gosford Park Whisk

In the gloam of a country manor,  
a woman stirs the whisper of eggs,  
transfixing a simmering gaze  
upon the idle realm of lords.  
Mrs. Croft's whisk speaks a code,  
echoes of vanished mornings  
where contempt brews in darkened corners,  
a magic trick simmering in a silver bowl,  
and who cares who dunnit?  
The cook always knows.
